direction.raw_text: ? Kay remains utterly silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, whoever it is, you're short on funding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing is what it seems, kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah, my bad '86 Ford LTD. That's a luxury ride. C'mon, who ya with? Kay pulls the car to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm part of a secret organization that monitors and polices alien activity on earth. Kay opens the door and gets out of the car. Edwards follows. EXT. PAWN SHOP - NIGHT Edwards looks around. Sees they're standing in front of a PAWN SHOP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is where we're going? They get out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack Jeebs? Guy buys from chain snatchers. Doesn't even sell guns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, you think it's worth shaking him up, fine. I'll do my thing. Then I want some answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do your "thing," kid.  Edwards goes inside. INT. PAWN SHOP - NIGHT JACK JEEBS is the sleazy, sarcastic proprietor of the Pawn Shop. He's not easily intimidated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Officer Edwards. Oh, hey, geez, how'd these get here? I thought I turned 'em in to the proper authorities. He casually brushes some Rolexes off the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Way I hear it, Jeebs, you into something a little hotter than some stolen Rolexes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure -- I'm a big crack dealer now. I just work here because I love the hours. This pisses Edwards off. He grabs Jeebs by the collar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm talking about guns, Jeebs. High-tech stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, Edwards, whatcha see is what I got.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you show him the imports, Jeebs. At the sound of Kay's voice, Jeebs suddenly pales, a look of fear coming over his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: H-hiya Kay, how are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The imports, Jeebs. Now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I got outta that business a long time ago, Kay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you lie to me? I hate it when you lie. He pulls his own gun and aims it at Jeebs' forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa, whoa, Kay, hold on a minute here...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to count to three. Edwards, seeing that Kay is getting somewhere, joins in the routine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll do it, Jeebs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've seen him do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Talk to me, Jeebs, he's crazy when he's like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's always crazy. (to Kay) Take a cruise. Get a massage -- KAY Three. KA-BOOM! Kay blows Jeebs' head off and Jeebs' body collapses to the floor. Edwards is shocked. Edwards pulls his own weapon and points it at Kay's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put down the gun and put your hands on the counter!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I warned him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drop the weapon!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You warned him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are under arrest. You have the right to remain silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you relax?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't do that. Edwards whirls around to see Jeebs' BODY, growing another head. Only takes four or five seconds. Kay calmly shoves his gun up against Jeebs' baby-soft new cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know how much that hurts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show us what you got, Jeebs. Or I'll use up another one. Jeebs, panicked, hits a button on the underside of the counter, which promptly flips over, revealing yet another dusty shelf, piled high with junk -- -- but this is all alien junk. Weapons, mostly, bizarre, otherworldly weapons of all shapes and sizes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edwards? Edwards, still dazed by Jeebs' regrown head, glances down at all the weapons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, this. This is what I saw. Kay looks at Jeebs, pissed off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sold a carbonizer with implosion capacity to an unlicensed cephlapoid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looked all right to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A carbonizer is an assassin's weapon, Jeebs. Who was the target?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Kay raises the weapon again, threatening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeebs!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know! Kay lowers his gun, gestures to the shelf full of weapons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is all confiscated. All of it. I want you on the next transport off this rock. Or I'll shoot you where it doesn't grow back. Jeebs nods, point taken. Kay leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I'll be by tomorrow for those Rolexes. Shaken, Edwards follows. EXT. PAWN SHOP -- NIGHT Edwards staggers out of the shop, trying to get the day's events straight in his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The eyelids, fine ... and the jumping thing ... and the gun ... okay, but the head?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Searching for a handle on the moment here? A place to file all this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See a head doesn't do that, it doesn't just grow back. (looking up) What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't help you, kid. Only comfort I can offer is that tomorrow, you won't remember a thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no. This I'm gonna remember for a long, long time. Kay pulls the neuralyzer from his pocket. He hesitates for the briefest of moments -- as if this particular neuralyzation is different than all the others. Then he puts on his sunglasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever see one of these?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. CHINESE RESTAURANT - NIGHT -- the flash dims on EDWARDS and KAY, sitting at a table in a Chinese restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and the wife says yeah, Harry, I know, but this one's eating my popcorn! He busts out laughing. Edwards, across from him, is completely disoriented. He looks down. There's a half-eaten order of broccoli beef and several empty bottles of beer on the table in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh? Kay checks his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoops. Gotta run. Thanks for the egg rolls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where am I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See what I mean about tequila? You're a bright young man, James. Just lay off the sauce. I'll see you tomorrow, nine a.m. sharp. He turns and walks out. Edwards checks his watch. A WAITRESS appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another beer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coffee. Please. She walks off. Edwards looks at the table. There is a business card lying next to his plate, on which Kay has handwritten "James D. Edwards, Saturday, 9 a.m., 504 Battery Drive." Edwards looks at it, puzzled. He turns the card over and looks at the other side. There's not much there, no name, no phone or fax number, no e-mail address. Just three little letters, dead in the middle of the card:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I go out, I work my butt off to make a living, all I want is to come home to a nice clean house with a nice fat steak on the table, but instead I get this -- this
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. FARMHOUSE - NIGHT A lonely farmhouse stands amid the fields of upstate New York farm country. Several lights are on and through a window we can see the silhouette of a MAN sitting at the kitchen table, the silhouette of a WOMAN hovering over him, bringing things to him. The Man (EDGAR) waves his arms, ranting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I don't even know what you call this! In the sky above, it's one of those brilliant star fields. But something strange is happening with one of those stars -- it's getting bigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you what it looks like, it looks like poison. Don't you take that away, I'm eating that, damn it! It is poison, isn't it?! No, that star isn't getting bigger, it's moving. Toward us. Fast. It goes from a pinpoint to a dime, to a nickel, to a quarter, and works its way into fruit metaphors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear to God, I would not be surprised if it was, the way you skulk around here like a dog been hit too much -- or ain't been hit enough, I can't make up my mind. Okay, we're way past watermelon now, that thing is huge, and it's starting to glow hot red as it enters the earth's atmosphere, headed straight toward us, coming here, to Beatrice and Edgar's place. The blazing fireball barrels through the sky, SNAPS off a couple trees -- EDGAR (O.S.) You're useless, Beatrice! The only thing that pulls its weight around here is my goddamn truck! -- and SLAMS right through a pickup truck parked in the driveway. A concussive BLAST follows, then a geyser of smoke and flame erupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay here! The silhouette of Edgar leaps to its feet, races to the door, and throws it open. Edgar is everything his voice led us to expect -- a nasty, bug-eyed redneck carrying a twelve-gauge shotgun. His mouth agape, he walks across the yard and stares at the hulking shell that was his truck. The skeleton of the truck is still there, but there's a huge, smoldering hole in it, a hole that goes at least ten feet down into the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Figures. He walks to the truck and touches the door handle. Hot. Using his shirt tail, he opens the door and peers down into the hole. IN THE HOLE, he sees a smooth curve of metal and a few blinking lights. Embedded into the ground is, indeed, a spaceship, maybe eight feet across. BEATRICE calls from behind him, standing in the doorway fearfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it, Edgar?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get your big butt back in that house! Beatrice does as she's told, closing the door behind her. Edgar turns back to the smoldering rock, raising his shotgun in defense. AN OTHERWORLDLY VOICE comes from deep in the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Place projectile weapon on ground. Edgar staggers back a step, terrified. But then he regains himself, raises the weapon, and steps forward, pointing it menacingly down into the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can have my gun when you pry it from my cold, dead fingers! There is a pause while the voice thinks about this offer. Finally, it responds, in a voice and cadence remarkably similar to Edgar's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your proposal is acceptable. A long, hairy pincer flashes out of the hole, grabs Edgar by the head, and pulls him down into the hole. From deep in the hole, we hear a terrible RIPPING sound, like a bedsheet being torn in half. There are some disgusting GUSHY sounds, then a moment later, something flies out of the hole and FLOPS onto the ground next to the truck. It's Edgar. Well, sort of. His body parts still hang together -- face, arms, legs, even clothes -- but everything inside has been removed and now he just lies there, flat and empty, like a tuxedo on the floor after the prom. The shotgun flies out and lands beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. FARMHOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT BEATRICE sits at the kitchen table, terrified, still wiping away tears from Edgar's diatribe. The door opens and EDGAR comes back into the kitchen, seemingly fleshed out again, leaving the door hanging open behind him. He carries the shotgun. She looks up at him, anxious. But his face is a blank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What on earth was it?! He looks at her strangely. When he speaks, his voice is different than before. More refined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sugar. Pause. She looks out the window, at the smoking truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never seen sugar do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me sugar. Puzzled, Beatrice gets up, goes to the cabinet, and grabs a bag of sugar. She holds it out to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In water. Frightened, she takes a glass of water from the table. She dumps some of the sugar into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More. She puts more, till the glass is brimming. She stirs it quickly with a knife and hands it to him, her hand trembling. Edgar takes it and downs it in a single gulp. Beatrice stares at Edgar, no idea what to think. She notices something odd about the skin on his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edgar, your skin! It's -- it's -- just hanging off your bones! Edgar drops the glass and looks in a window, to catch his reflection. He reaches up -- -- and twists his whole face, as if adjusting a ski mask, then tucks the skin of his neck back into his shirt collar.  He looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That better? Beatrice faints. EXT. FARMHOUSE - NIGHT Stillness. Silence. A loud SCRAPING sound comes from the pit left by the spaceship. The nose of the ship itself rises up out of the pit, wavers, keeps moving, and finally CRUNCHES to the ground outside the pit. EDGAR climbs out of the pit, breathing heavily. He dusts himself off and continues pushing the ship, along the ground, off into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MIB BUILDING - DAY The next morning. EDWARDS, holding the small MIB business card in his hand, compares the address written down by Kay to the address on the utterly nondescript building in front of him. It's seven stories high, gray, windowless, perfectly square, squatting on a bridge over a road like a fat guy on the john.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe, I'm not sure, see, I got this card -- GUARD Elevator. Push the "call" button. And he goes back to his comic book. Edwards, maybe out of nothing more than curiosity at this point, walks across the room, toward the elevator. As he draws close, the elevator doors WHOOSH open, expecting him. INT. MIB BUILDING - ENTRANCE ELEVATOR - DAY Edwards steps inside and turns around. The doors close. He pushes the "call" button and waits, but the elevator doesn't move. Instead, doors on the other side of the elevator slide open silently behind him. Edwards waits, unaware. From behind him, somebody clears their throat. Edwards turns around, and finds himself standing in -- INT. MIB BUILDING - INTERVIEW ROOM - DAY This back room is every bit as mysterious and unfamiliar as the entryway. Standing at the front of the room is ZED, a wire-haired career G-man, an old school bureaucrat, wearing the exact same kind of suit Kay had on last night. SIX OTHER HOT RECRUITS sit in egg-shaped chairs, staring at Edwards. One chair is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're late. Sit down. Edwards takes the remaining chair. The elevator doors slide shut. Zed continues addressing the Recruits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Zed. You're all here because you're the best of the best. Marines, Navy
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Battery Drive." INT. MIB BUILDING - TUNNEL VENT ROOM - DAY EDWARDS steps through a heavily barred metal door and into long, bizarre room. One wall is entirely dominated by the enormous blades of a tunnel vent air intake. There is an elevator at the far end of the room and an OLD SECURITY GUARD, the rent-a-cop kind, reading a comic book on a folding metal chair halfway across. Edwards walks across the room, his footsteps ECHOING. The Guard looks up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Army Rangers...NYPD. They all turn and regard Edwards a little smugly. He gives it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we're looking for one of you. Just one. What will follow is a series of simple tests designed to quantify motor skills, hand-eye coordination, concentration, stamina -- I see we have a question. Edwards's hand is, indeed, up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, uh -- I'm sorry, it's just no one really asked this, but -- why, exactly, are we doing this? Silence. Then one of the young recruits eagerly raises his hand. Zed calls on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jake Jensen, West Point, graduate with honors. We're here because you're looking for the best of the best of the best, sir! Edwards tries to stifle a laugh, but can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's so funny, Edwards?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, sir. This guy. "Best of the best of the best of the best of the --" (realizing nobody is with him on this) It just struck me as -- (totally serious) Humorous. Sir. Short pause. Then Zed continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Let's get going. INT. MIB BUILDING - INTERVIEW ROOM - LATER - DAY The recruits scribble away at the written test. It's a thick document -- reasoning skills, general knowledge, diagrams.  The RECRUITS seem to be really powering through it, filling in answer after answer. But no desks have been provided for them, and they're all still in their chairs, writing uncomfortably on their thighs or knees. EDWARDS is really struggling. He writes two words on one answer, then decides to erase it. The lack of a writing surface is driving him crazy; his pencil even TEARS through the page. He looks up. In the middle of the tile floor, there is an unused table. Edwards gets up, goes to it, grabs hold -- -- and drags it, SCREECHING DEAFENINGLY, back to his chair. Everybody looks up, wincing at the horrible sound that fills the room. Edwards sits back down, now writing on the table.  That's better. Zed raises an eyebrow. He stares at Edwards, then looks up, toward a smoked glass window. Behind the dark glass, a FIGURE stands, staring, unemotional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MIB BUILDING -- SHOOTING GALLERY -- DAY SEVEN WEAPONS rest on a table in the middle of an otherwise empty, triangular room. The SEVEN RECRUITS stand in front of the table. There's an odd moment -- where everyone sort of looks around: at each other, at the blank walls...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone, uh...any of you guys know what we're doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking for the best of the best of the best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, yeah, I know, but... And then .. suddenly -- The two far walls pull apart. The whole room pulsates and the air is suddenly filled with a bewildering swirl of stroboscopic images, both human and alien. Everywhere is color, light and movement -- a holographic mass of strange shapes and characters moving simultaneously. The Recruits lunge for the weapons, snapping them up and taking aim. SIX SHOTS are fired at once. And then, a second later, a SEVENTH SHOT is fired. Everyone sort of looks at Edwards, who puts his gun down last. There's an awkward silence. Then the door opens. Light pours in, and ZED with it. Even the highly competitive cadets can't help but feel some sympathy as Zed walks straight to Edwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hell happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hesitated, sir. Zed looks into the gallery. Most obvious in the frozen tableau of creatures is a lunging, snarling beast, which has three bullet holes in its chest. Next to it is a massively deformed humanoid creature with a large hook for a head, which also has three holes in it. In the back corner of the gallery, there is a single bullet hole in a pretty eight-year-old girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I ask why you felt little Tiffany deserved to die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was the only one who actually seemed dangerous. At the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how did you come to that conclusion?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hook-head guy. You explain to me how he can think with a hook for a head. Answer; it's not his head. His head is that butt-ugly bean-bag thing over there. 'Cause if you look at the snarling beast-guy, he's not snarling, he's sneezing -- he's got tissues in his hand. No threat there, and anyhow, the girl's books were way too advanced for an eight-year-old's. And besides, from where I'm looking, she was the only one who appeared to have a motive. And I don't appreciate your jumping down my throat about it. Sideways glances from the other recruits. Zed sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or, uh -- do I owe her an apology?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MIB BUILDING - OBSERVATION ROOM/INTERVIEW ROOM - DAY ZED and KAY stand behind smoked glass, staring at the RECRUITS, who are still in the shooting gallery, waiting for a decision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's got a real problem with authority.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So do I. The guy ran down a cephlapoid, Zed. On foot. Tenacity. That I can use.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope you know what you're doing. Zed turns and walks away. Kay stares through the glass, at EDWARDS, who stands alone on one side of the room, apart from the rest of the group. Zed reappears on the other side of the glass, coming through a door and into the shooting gallery. As he talks, Kay turns and walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations, you're everything we've come to expect from years of government training. Now, if you'll just follow me, we have one more test to administer, an eye exam. INT. MIB BUILDING - HALLWAY - DAY The RECRUITS follow ZED out of the shooting gallery and into a long hallway. Zed motions them off to the left. EDWARDS is the last one out of the room, but he stops as he steps into the hallway. KAY is outside the door, waiting for him. Edwards recognizes him from last night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You! Hey, what's goin' on? The other recruits continue down the hall with Zed. Kay doesn't answer, just gestures to Edwards to follow him down the hall, which he does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back in the mid-fifties, the government started a little underfunded agency with the simple and laughable purpose of making contact with a race not of this planet. As they pass an alcove, Edwards notices the six other Recruits, who have been herded into a corner. Zed, addressing them, pulls a neuralyzer from his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, if you'll look directly at the end of this device. He holds a neuralyzer up in front of them, and the Recruits stare obediently at it as Zed slips on a pair of black sunglasses. Edwards stares, fascinated, but Kay's hand reaches in and yanks him away, just as Zed's neuralyzer FLASHES WHITE. INT. MIB BUILDING - HALLWAY - DAY As KAY leads EDWARDS down an impossibly long corridor, he hands him a file folder stuffed thick with eight by ten photographs. He hands Jay the first picture, a shot of eight or nine MEN in plain black suits standing around a fifties-style office with metal desks and fluorescent lights. DEE and ZED are there, much younger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody thought the agency was a joke. Except the aliens. They made contact on March 2nd, 1961, outside New  York City. Another photograph, a grainy black and white image of two ships hovering in the night sky -- classic flying saucer shapes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There were nine of us that night. Seven agents. An amateur astronomer. And one poor kid who got lost on the wrong back road. Yet another photograph, this one showing a young KAY, in a shirt and tie, holding a bouquet of flowers, staring at the open door of the landed flying saucer. ALIEN SHAPES are visible within.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You brought the aliens flowers? Kay steers Edwards to the right, down another corridor, just as long as the first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were intergalactic refugees with a simple request. Let us use the earth as an apolitical zone for people without a planet.  Ever see "Casablanca?" Same thing, no Nazis.  We agreed. So we masked all evidence of their landing. Another picture, this one of the 1964 World's Fair grounds, still under construction. Giant models of rockets mark the Fair's theme of space travel; most prominent in the construction are two tall towers, with the flying saucers now mounted at the top of each.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The 1964 World's Fair was a coverup?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why else would we hold it in Queens? (another hallway) Now left. More nonhumans arrive every year. They live among us, in secret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see. Not to change the subject, but when was your last cat-scan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every six months; it's company policy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, thanks for the very amusing morning, but I'm hopin' you'll show me where I came in?  'Cause this is where I go out. They have stopped next to an unmarked door. Kay throws it open and steps inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, sure, hang on, I wanna grab a coffee while we're right here. As Kay walks into the kitchenette, Edwards' jaw drops, his eyes widen, and he stares in wonderment -- -- at THREE WORM-LIKE ALIENS standing around a water cooler. Tall, impossibly thin, most certainly not from New York, the aliens hold an animated conversation in a language that seems like a combination of Esperanto and microphone feedback.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell me we've only got that powdered shit for cream again? One of the Worm Aliens answers him in their native tongue and points to the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. He finds the cream sitting out on the counter where the alien indicated, dumps some in his coffee, and comes back outside, closing the door behind him. He reaches up and gently pushes Edwards' jaw up, closing his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For future reference, this is a better look for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. BATTERY PARK - DAY EDWARDS, thrown for a major loop, sits like a zombie alongside KAY on a bench in Battery Park. Kay drinks his coffee while they talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any given time, around fifteen hundred landed aliens are on the planet, the majority right here in Manhattan. Most aliens are decent enough, just trying to make a living.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cab drivers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not as many as you'd think. Humans, for the most part, don't have a clue. Don't want one, either. They're happy. They think they've got a pretty good bead on things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why the big secret? People are smart, they can handle it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A person is smart. People are dumb. Everything they've ever "known" has been proven to be wrong. A thousand years ago everybody knew as a fact, that the earth was the center of the universe. Five hundred years ago, they knew it was flat. Fifteen minutes ago, you knew we humans were alone on it. Imagine what you'll know tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's the catch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you'll gain in perspective, you'll lose in ways you're too young to comprehend. You give up everything. Sever every human contact. No one will know you exist. Ever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not even allowed a favorite shirt. There.  That's the speech I never heard. That's the choice I never got.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold up. You track me down, put me through those stupid-ass tests, now you're trying to talk me out of it. I don't get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got 'til sun-up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it worth it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You find out, you let me know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. BATTERY PARK - DUSK Almost nighttime now, and the park is empty. EDWARDS is still on the bench. And still thinking. Above him, the stars are coming out. Slowly, he looks up, into the vastness of the heavens. DISSOLVE TO: INT. GARAGE - DAY The next morning. A door opens on a garage and an ORKIN MAN steps inside, carrying a tank of toxic gas. The morning light spills on an abundance of spiders, crawling everywhere -- big ones, small ones, hundreds of them have moved in and taken over this dusty place. The Orkin Man sighs and sets down his tank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, well, well. Movin' right in, are we? Think we own the place? He unfurls a hose from the side of the tank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got a little eviction notice for you, boys. He raises a mask to his face and unscrews the handle on the top of the tank. LETHAL GAS starts to HISS from the end of the hose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just what exactly do you think you're doing? The Orkin Man turns around. EDGAR stands in the doorway to the garage, staring at him disdainfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Takin' care of your pest problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Pest" problem? "Pest?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. You got a hell of an infestation. Edgar advances on him, slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I have noticed an infestation here. Everywhere I look, in fact. Nothing but undeveloped, unevolved, barely conscious pond scum. So convinced of their own superiority as they scurry about their short, pointless lives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well -- yeah. Don't you want to get rid of 'em?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the worst way. Edgar lashes out quickly, jerking the mask off the Orkin Man's face with one hand -- -- and shoving the gas hose down his throat with the other. THE ORKIN MAN'S CAR KEYS drop to the garage floor, and Edgar picks them up. EXT. GARAGE - DAY A six-by-ten sheet of plywood THUDS to the driveway outside the garage. EDGAR raises one end of it so it's hanging off the back end of the Orkin man's van -- now it's a ramp. He walks off and we hear that familiar SCRAPING sound again. Edgar, GRUNTING with the effort, slowly pushes his spaceship up the ramp and into the back of the Orkin truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MIB BUILDING - TUNNEL VENT ROOM - DAY EDWARDS stands in the middle of the tunnel vent room, the same one he first came into yesterday. The elevator doors open and KAY, obviously summoned by the OLD SECURITY GUARD, stands waiting for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One thing you gotta know right now. Edwards walks briskly forward and gets in the elevator with Kay. INT. MIB BUILDING - ELEVATOR - DAY Inside the elevator, the doors WHOOSH shut, KAY turns a key in a certain floor number, and the descent begins. EDWARDS continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. I'm in because there's some next-level shit going on around here, and I'm with that. Before you beam me up, there are a couple of things we need to get straight. You chose me 'cause you recognize the skills. So as of now you can cease with all of that calling me "son" or "kid" or "sport." Cool?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cool, slick. Now about those skills of yours, The elevator doors -- INT. MIB BUILDING - HEADQUARTERS - DAY -- slide open on Men in Black headquarters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As of this moment, they don't mean much. It's unlike anything we've ever seen -- huge, multileveled, of sixties design, polished steel and glass. The workplaces are sleek and uncluttered, manned by both HUMANS and ALIENS. Most of the Aliens stay in the background, like the UPSIDE-DOWN GUY who walks on the ceiling, shuffling papers. KAY and EDWARDS step off the elevator and onto a platform that looks out over the whole place. Kay leads him down into the complex. First, they walk past a sort of passport control center, where a human BUREAUCRAT at a desk is checking the documents of a line of ALIENS who've just arrived. There are a dozen bizarre life forms in that line, CHATTING in half a dozen different alien tongues. Edwards slows as they pass, listening to the PASSPORT CONTROL OFFICER as he addresses an ARQUILLIAN, a large, humanoid visitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Purpose of trip?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diplomatic mission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duration of stay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carrying any fruits or vegetables? Edwards just stares, fascinated, but Kay grabs him by the arm and hurries him along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go. He's a little...grouchy. Kay moves him into the central hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A couple of hours wait after a 17-light-year flight would get on anybody's nerves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What branch of the government do we report to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None. They started asking too many questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So who pays for all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, we hold a few patents on gadgets we confiscated from our out-of-state visitors. Velcro. Microwave Ovens. Liposuction. AT A STORAGE CAGE, Kay turns a key in the lock of a caged-in area and throws the door open. Inside, there are piles of sophisticated-looking devices stacked on shelves and tabletops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. A new recording device to replace CD's.  So now I gotta buy the White Album again? (something else) This is amusing. Universal translator. He holds up a cylindrical metal tube and a small wire clip that looks like a lapel microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not supposed to have it. I'll tell you why.  Human thought is so primitive it's considered an infectious disease. Makes you proud, doesn't it? Edwards picks up a small yellow ball from one of the shelves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't touch that! THE BALL ZINGS OUT OF EDWARDS' HANDS -- it flies out into the main complex -- hits the ceiling and ricochets around the room, faster than the eye can follow -- VARIOUS SHOTS OF HUMANS AND ALIENS ducking, dodging, and jumping out of its way. ON KAY as he calmly, a little wearily, slips an odd-looking metal glove over his right hand... He raises his hand and the yellow ball zings into it -- Kay catches the ball, calmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caused the '77 New York blackout. Practical joke by the Great Attractor. He thought it was funny as hell. They leave the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry! ON THE MAIN FLOOR, they walk briskly across the room, reaching a giant screen on the far wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Observation, the heart of our little endeavor. The screen displays a map of the world on which thousands of tiny lights blink in all parts of the globe, log lines of data flashing next to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This map shows the location of every registered alien on earth at any given time. Some of them we keep under constant surveillance. He hits a button on the console and the map is replaced by hundreds of boxes, each with smaller video images.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone on these screens is an alien. In public -- normal. In private -- you'll get the idea. ON THE SCREENS, we see live images of aliens. Aliens who look alien are in spots where they can't be seen.  Aliens who look human are functioning right out in public -- including SAM DONALDSON. MICHAEL JACKSON. And TONY ROBBINS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meet the twins. Kay gestures to two small, bony CREATURES with eight arms each and a single eye growing out of a central stalk in their heads. They turn around and wave two or three arms each.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta be honest about something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It makes no sense?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It makes perfect sense. When I was a third grader in Philadelphia, they told me I was crazy 'cause I swore that our teacher was from, like, Venus or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Edelson. Edwards, stunned, looks at Kay as 4-Eyes boots her onto the screen: Mean face, cat glasses. Bony fingers. Extremely well-hidden tail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jupiter, actually. Well, one of the moons. With their remaining arms, they punch button after button on the enormous console. ZED, who was standing up close to the screen, walks over to Edwards, sizing him up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your jacket size, Edwards?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh -- forty regular.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then let's put it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put what on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The last suit you'll ever wear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MIB BUILDING - LOCKER ROOM - DAY Like the rest of the place, the MIB locker room is all white. White walls, white floor, white ceiling, white lockers. ZED'S VOICE comes over:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From now on, you'll dress only in attire specially sanctioned by MIB Special Services. EDWARDS reaches out and opens a white locker, revealing a BLACK SUIT hung from a hanger in the middle. Above it, on the shelf, a BLACK HAT and a pair of BLACK SUNGLASSES. On the bottom, a pair of SHINY BLACK SHOES. INT. MIB BUILDING - HEADQUARTERS - DAY KAY is at a computer terminal. On screen are Edwards's birth certificate, driver's license, social security card, library card, everything. ZED'S VOICE continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll conform to the identity we give you, eat where we tell you, live where we tell you, get approval for any expenditure over a hundred dollars. INT. MIB BUILDING LASER BOOTH - DAY EDWARDS stands in a cramped white booth. He holds both his hands on a TEN-FINGERED KEYPAD, pressing down hard. The pad glows red, a SEARING sound comes from his hands, and he grimaces as more lasers instantly and (not at all) painlessly change his fingerprints.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will have no identifying marks of any kind.  You will not stand out in any way. INT. MIB BUILDING - HEADQUARTERS - DAY One by one, KAY deletes Edwards's identity cards. On the computer screen is Edwards' full name -- JAMES DARREL EDWARDS III. Kay punches a couple keys, and the cursor begins to sweep from right to left, starting to eliminate the rightmost letters of Edwards's name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your entire image is carefully crafted to leave no lasting memory whatsoever with anyone you encounter. INT. MIB BUILDING - LOCKER ROOM - DAY Pants come off the hanger. The white shirt is removed. More letters are eliminated from his name. It reads "JAMES DARREL ED..." then "JAMES DARR..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a rumor, recognizable only as deja vu and dismissed just as quickly. You don't exist; you were never even born. The coat is removed. The hat comes off the shelf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anonymity is your name. Silence your native tongue. "JAMES..." "JAM..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are no longer part of "the system." We're above the system. Over it. Beyond it. Feet slip into black shoes. A belt is buckled. A tie pushed up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're "them." We're "they." On screen, all that's left is the letter "J." As the coat is buttoned, we notice the sleeve. Monogrammed on the cuff is, simply, the letter "J."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are the Men in Black. INT. MIB BUILDING - HEADQUARTERS - DAY Looking slick and handsome in his extremely sharp suit, JAMES D EDWARDS III -- or, rather, JAY -- steps into the doorway from the locker room. He reaches into his pocket, takes out the sunglasses, and looks at KAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The difference between you and me? He slips on the sunglasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I make this look good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. NEW JERSEY - EARLY MORNING We are looking at a telephoto shot of Manhattan in all its splendor. We see the Orkin van topping a hill, heading towards Manhattan. INT. MIB BUILDING - ZED'S OFFICE - DAY Zed's office is a circular, windowed room elevated above the main floor of MIB headquarters. JAY and KAY sit across the desk from Zed. There are five video monitors on a wall behind Zed's desk, and on each monitor is another Man in Black, in different parts of the world, the city name and a clock ticking in a corner of the image. While Zed talks, he goes through paperwork on his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, let's see. (to one of the monitors) Bee, we got the deposed sur-prefect of Sinalee touching down in the forest outside Portland tonight. I'm pulling you down from Anchorage to do a meet-and-greet. BEE, an agent on one of the monitors, nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Humanoid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wish. Bring a sponge. (going through memos) What else -- everybody, we gotta keep Rolling Fish-Goat out of the sewer system, he's scaring the rats. And Bobo the Squat wants to reveal himself on "Unsolved Mysteries." Bee, make sure he doesn't. He turns a page, coming across a red memo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red-letter from last night -- we had an un-authorized landing somewhere in upstate New York farm country. Keep your ears open for this one, Kay, we're not hosting a galactic kegger down here. Next to him, his computer screen BEEPS importantly.  Zed looks over at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, well, well -- we got a skimmer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landed alien out of zone. (to Zed) Who is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Redgick. He's not cleared to leave Manhattan but he's way out of town right now, stuck in traffic on the New Jersey Turnpike. Why don't you take Jay? This is a good one for him to warm up on. EXT. MIB BUILDING - BATTERY PARK - DAY JAY and KAY come out the front of MIB headquarters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo, wussup with Zed? (imitating him) "Go get em, tiger. We're not hosting an intergalactic kegger..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zed was saving the world before you were born, son. Show some respect. An MIB MECHANIC pulls up in Kay's black LTD and hops out, leaving the door open. Jay sizes up the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got the use of unlimited technology from the entire universe and we cruise around in this? Kay glares at Jay. He's getting annoyed. INT. MIB LTD - DAY They get in and slam the doors. Kay starts the car and the engine HUMS quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seat belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, ya'll gotta learn how to talk to people. You could be a little kinder and gentler. Kay grits his teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buckle up, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now did that hurt? Kay shifts the car into reverse. The awesome power of the car kicks in and Jay sails forward, THWACKING into the dash. Kay shifts into forward and taps the gas, SLAMMING Jay back into his seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Makin' fun of my ride... A LIGHTED PANEL rotates into place between the two front seats.  Jay's hand falls by accident on a flashing red button in the panel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jay. The button?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never push the button, Jay. Jay jerks his hand away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. HIGHWAY - SIDE OF THE ROAD - DAY The LTD is now stopped by the side of the road, dust swirling around it. Ahead of it, another car has pulled over. KAY gets out, JAY follows a moment later, shaky-legged. Kay walks up to the window of the car they've stopped. The DRIVER, a guy in his mid-thirties with a WIFE in her mid-thirties, rolls the window down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: License and registration, please. The Driver hands over some documents. Kay flips through them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Other license and registration, please. The guy digs out two other cards and hands those over. Jay peers over Kay's shoulder. The photographs on the "RESIDENT ALIEN ID"cards are of two friendly-looking reptile types, husband and wife, smiling atthe camera, their long, skinny tongues dangling in a friendly sort of way. Kay hands them back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your resident card has you restricted to the five boroughs only. Where do you think you're going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my wife! She's -- she's -- well, look! Kay leans down and looks in the window. MRS. REDGICK is in front, MOANING in pain, holding her swollen belly. Kay straightens up, fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God. How soon? Mrs. Redgick SCREAMS in pain. Real soon. For the first time since we've seen him, Kay is nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. All right. No big deal. (to Jay) You handle it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, it's easy, you just sorta -- catch. Mrs. Redgick SCREAMS again. Redgick gets out of the car, worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure he knows what he's doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, hell, sure, he does this all the time. C'mon, let him work, Redgick, I wanna ask you something. Kay gives Jay a supportive SLAP on the back and leads Redgick away, to the rear of the car. Jay stays in the background and opens the rear door, tentatively. He leans down, into the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God! I see it I see it I see it! A few yards from the car, Kay turns Redgick to face him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Croagg the Midwife's back on 64th and 8th. You were headed out of town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we're, uh -- meeting someone. Suddenly a TENTACLE whips out from between Mrs. Redgick's legs, CRACKS the whip once, and wraps around the door post, grabbing hold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh sweet Jesus Mother of God did you see that?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So? Who you meeting?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's -- a ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? I didn't see a departure clearance for today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't? Uh, well -- it was an emergency. Now a SECOND TENTACLE whips out, but this one wraps around Jay's neck and pulls tight. He GASPS, choking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guys -- guys -- KAY Doin' fine, Ace. (back to Redgick) What kind of emergency? What's the rush to get off the planet all of a sudden?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help?! HELP! Hello?! He starts tugging for all he's worth, but the fight is sort of going against him, as the tentacles pull him in even harder than he tries to pull the baby out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We just don't like the neighborhood anymore. Some of the -- new arrivals. Redgick looks at Kay, clearly concealing something, but darts his eyes away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What new arrivals? This have anything to do with the crasher from last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you guys do this later?! But in that moment, Jay finally gets a foot up on the door frame, acquires leverage, and RIPS the baby free. He falls, flat on his back in the dirt, the multi-tentacled lizardlike baby resting squarely on his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh -- oh -- oh -- man. Kay turns and claps Redgick on the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations! It's a lizard. Jay looks down at the creature COOING and nestling on his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you know, it is sorta -- It vomits on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. HIGHWAY - SIDE OF THE ROAD - MIB LTD - DAY Back in the car, JAY wipes the last of the puke off his suit while KAY starts up the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything about that seem unusual to you? Jay just looks at him, very Jack Benny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of "new arrival" would scare Redgick so bad that he'd risk a warp jump with a newborn? (thinks) Let's check the hot sheets. EXT. NEWSSTAND - DAY CLOSE ON on various supermarket tabloids as a hand flips through them. There are headlines like "POPE A FATHER!"and "TOP DOCTORS BAFFLED -- BABY BORN PREGNANT!" and "MAN EATS OWN HOUSE!" (the subhead on that one is "And That's Just the Appetizer, Says Neighbor.") KAY and JAY are at a downtown newsstand. Kay is furiously searching through the tabs; Jay is standing behind him, a little embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are the hot sheets? Kay pulls a copy of the Weekly World News from the stand and gives the guy a buck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Best damn investigative reporting on the planet.  But hey, go ahead, read the New York Times if you want. They get lucky sometimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're actually looking for tips in a supermarket tabloid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not looking for. Found. He SMACKS the paper down on the hood in front of Jay, the pages turned open to a headline in typeface so large one would think it reserved for the Second Coming: Farm wife says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. GEM AND JEWELRY STORE - ORKIN VAN - DAY A flap of skin, now getting gray and crusty with age, hangs off EDGAR's neck as he sits in the front of his Orkin van. He sucks as hard as he possibly can on a straw stuck into a Jolt Cola ("Double the Sugar! Triple the Caffeine!"), one of a six-pack that sits on the dashboard. Across the street, Edgar sees a short, older man come out of one of the jewelry shops on Thirty-Fifth Street. Edgar drops the soda and stares. The Older Man (ROSENBERG), is carrying a cat and an ornate rosewood jewelry box. Carefully, he sets the box down and lovingly places the cat on top of it while he locks all five locks on the door to his distinctive shop. That finished, he picks up the cat, then the box, then waddles off down the street, one under each arm. Edgar drops the truck into gear and follows him, slowly, trolling along behind him. ON THE STREET, Rosenberg walks happily along, HUMMING to himself. He gives his cat a little peck. As he rounds a corner, we recognize the tune he's humming -- "I've Got the Whole World In My Hands." The Orkin van rounds the corner behind him. Following. CUT TO: EXT. FARMHOUSE - DAY The LTD pulls to a stop at the end of the driveway that leads to Beatrice's farmhouse, where the alien ship landed. The wrecked pickup truck is still there. JAY and KAY get out, very undercover cop. Jay starts up the driveway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not so fast. Walk up slow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Part of the routine. Makes it look like we're sizing up the situation. Gives her time to get the wrong impression. BEATRICE appears in the door to the house, curious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puts some fear into her. Makes things go smoother. Beatrice calls to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you gentlemen? Beatrice looks much better than the last time we saw her -- more nicely dressed, a touch of makeup, a smile on her face. Kay pulls a black card from his wallet and extends it to her as she draws close. As she reaches for it, the card reforms into an FBI badge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you do, ma'am, I'm Special Agent Manheim, this is Agent Black, FBI. Had a few questions about your visitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you here to make fun of me too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No ma'am. We at the FBI don't have a sense of humor that we're aware of. Mind if we come in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Lemonade?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. FARMHOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY In the living room, KAY sips some of her lemonade and winces. JAY moves through the room, checking it out as BEATRICE tells her story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And they said to me, "If he was murdered, how could he walk back in the house?" And I must admit, I was a little stumped by that one. But I know Edgar. And that wasn't him. It was more like something else that was wearing him. Like a suit. An Edgar suit. A little GIGGLE escapes her at the thought. Jay, over by a bookcase, notices a framed PHOTO OF EDGAR, kneeling in the woods, proudly about to skin a deer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn. If he was this ugly before he was an alien...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyway, when I came to, he was gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did he say anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! He asked for water. Sugar water, if I remember.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sugar water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you taste her lemonade? Kay nods, puts on his sunglasses. Takes out another pair, hands them to Jay. Kay draws his neuralyzer. FLASH! Beatrice freezes, staring straight ahead as if hypnotized. Kay takes Jay's glasses off and hands them back to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray Bans. (pulling off Jay's sunglasses) Okay, Beatrice. There was no alien, and the flash of light you saw in the sky wasn't a
direction.name: direction

result.heading: BALL ZINGS OUT OF EDWARDS' HANDS --

direction.raw_text: . Swamp gas from a weather balloon was trapped in a thermal pocket and refracted the light from Venus -- JAY Whoa! That thing erases her memory, and you give her a new one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Standard issue neuralyzer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's the best you can come up with?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On a more personal note, Beatrice, Edgar ran off with on old girlfriend. Go stay at your mother's for a few days and get over it. Decide you're better off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, and you're better off 'cause he never appreciated you anyway. In fact, you kicked him out, and now that he's gone, you ought to buy some new clothes, maybe hire a decorator or something...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. FARMHOUSE - DAY KAY is in the hole where the ship landed, investigating. He holds a pocket spectral analyzer over a section of scorched earth.  The analyzer shifts colors.  Red. Then Yellow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Kay...when am I gonna get one of those memory things? The spectral analyzer turns blue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you're ready. (re: analyzer) Please -- not green. Purple. And then green. Kay closes his eyes and sits back, leaning against the dirt. Above him, JAY leans over, staring down. Kay looks up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know what alien life form leaves a green spectral trail?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait -- don't tell me -- that was the question on Final Jeopardy last night. AT THE CAR, Kay snatches up the radio handset and keys the microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zed, we have a bug. He turns off the radio and sighs. Jay stands next to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna jump way past you and just guess that this is bad. Right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bugs thrive on carnage, Tiger.  They consume, infest and destroy. They live off the death and decay of other species.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So basically you have a racial problem with all insect-based life forms?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, kid -- imagine a giant cockroach five times smarter than Albert Einstein, four times stronger than an ox, nine times meaner than hell, strutting his stuff around Manhattan Island in his brand new Edgar suit. Does that sound like fun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a bug in town? Watch the morgues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. LESHKO'S DINER - DAY ROSENBERG, the jewelry store owner, steps out of a cab in the meat-packing district, still carrying the ornate box and his beloved cat. He heads into Leshko's, a Russian diner. A moment later, the Orkin van pulls to a stop across the street. INT. LESHKO'S DINER - DAY ROSENBERG comes into the tiny restaurant, squinting in the relative darkness. At a table in the middle, he sees a man eating alone -- an enormous, dignified, yet profoundly strange-looking man in his mid fifties. Rosenberg walks carefully over to the table, but does not sit down. The man (an ARQUILLIAN, and if we're eagle-eyed, we recognize him as the alien on a "diplomatic mission" from passport control) rises from his chair. He steps forward, to face Rosenberg, who sets the ornate box on the table. Immediately, ROSENBERG'S CAT jumps on top of it. Rosenberg and the Arquillian stare at each other for a long moment -- -- and then embrace each other. The embrace has an odd, formal quality to it, like mafiosi coming to a sitdown. They hold on, long and hard, and both seemed choked with emotion. Finally, they break apart and take their seats. They speak in a bizarre alien tongue, which is subtitled. Rosenberg wipes away tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry I'm late. The cab drivers on this planet are terrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your majesty, you are in grave danger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, and they overcharge you every time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, a bug landed here. We must get you off the planet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bug? He must know why I'm here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We think he does. (noticing the ornate box on the table) Is that what I think it is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, just some diamonds for your children. Do we have time to eat? The Arquillian relaxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. I ordered you some pirogi. INT. LESHKO'S DINER - KITCHEN - DAY In the kitchen, the Russian COOK slaps two orders of pirogi up on the stainless steel counter -- COOK Table six is up! -- and turns away, back to the grill. A HAND reaches in, takes the plates, and sets them on a tray. We follow the tray, but see only the right arm and aproned midsection of the waiter carrying it. He carries the tray along the counter toward a pair of swinging doors that lead out into the restaurant. The doors swing in as another WAITER sweeps into the kitchen, and our waiter heads out into the dining area. As the doors swing closed behind him, they reveal storage shelves crammed with bags of rice, cans of stewed tomatoes -- -- and a DEAD WAITER, literally folded in half and stuffed in among the shelves. INT. LESHKO'S DINER - DAY ROSENBERG and the ARQUILLIAN raise their glasses in a toast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the continued reign of the Arquillian Empire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the safety of the galaxy. They CLINK glasses and drink, just as the Waiter arrives. Still, we see only his arms and midsection as he sets the tray on a stand and lifts the plates of pirogi. He carries them to the table and sets them down. Rosenberg, setting his glass down next to the plate, catches a glimpse of the Waiter's hand -- -- just as an enormous silverfish bug slithers out of the waiter's sleeve and scurries across the table. The glass slips out of Rosenberg's hand, dumping wine all over the table. He looks up, slowly, and sees the Waiter's face. It's EDGAR. Another half dozen insects of all variety tumble out of Edgar's sleeves and scurry across the table. Rosenberg and the Arquillian freeze, paralyzed with fear. They seem to know what dire implications Edgar's presence holds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can kill us both -- but you will not find it. Edgar smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right about one thing. Suddenly a long STINGER whips out from under the back of Edgar's apron and zips under the table. First Rosenberg and then the Arquillian lurch forward their chairs, their faces contorting in pain. They both pitch forward, their faces slogging into fresh pirogi. The stinger SNAPS out from under the table and whips back under Edgar's apron. He moves quickly, searching their pockets, but he doesn't find what he's looking for. The cat, still perched on top of the ornate box, HISSES at him. Edgar reaches out and BATS the cat away with one vicious swipe of his hand. The animal HOWLS and flies across the room, landing in a WOMAN's lunch. The Woman SCREAMS. Now other DINERS' attention is drawn to Edgar's table, where two obviously dead men are being robbed by a waiter. There are SHOUTS of outrage, a few MEN rise out of their seats. Edgar grabs the ornate box and tries to open it, but finds it locked. With the furor rising around him, he shoves the box under one arm and bolts for the door. Rosenberg's cat leaps back onto the table and SNARLS at him as he goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. LESHKO'S DINER - DAY Later, and the Russian diner is now a crime scene, clustered with COPS and flashing lights. THREE BODIES, now on stretchers and covered with sheets, are being loaded into the back of ambulances. ROSENBERG'S CAT races out of a UNIFORMED COP's arms and leaps onto one of the stretchers, MEOWING mournfully. The Uniformed Cop turns to a POLICE INSPECTOR who is questioning the WOMAN from the diner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I supposed to do with the cat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Send it with the stiff. Let family claim it. The Cop nods and follows the stretcher with Rosenberg's body into the back of one of the ambulances, allowing the cat to ride on the chest of its dead owner for the time being. The doors of the wagon SLAM shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MORGUE - CORRIDOR - DAY The stretcher with the corpse on it is wheeled down a corridor in police headquarters. ROSENBERG'S CAT, still on his chest, MEOWS curiously as the stretcher approaches two doors with "City Morgue" written across them. The words split in half as the stretcher BANGS through the doors. INT. MORGUE - DAY The city morgue is a crowded, brightly-lit, tiled place with corpses parked left and right. Busy day in the Apple. The Cop wheeling the stretcher calls out to the CORONER, who's hunched over another body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do you want contestant number three? The coroner turns around. It's DR. LAUREL WEAVER, the woman who tried to speak to Jay before. She sighs and waves a hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the wall, I guess. (noticing) What's with the cat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, the cat. There's a problem with the cat. Sign here. Laurel signs his clipboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the problem with the cat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your problem. Laurel gives him a dirty look, but he laughs and leaves. She goes over to the stretcher and bends down, petting Rosenberg's cat gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you having a bad day, baby?  Cheer up. (of Rosenberg) His is worse. She sets the cat aside and wheels the stretcher under the lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okey-dokey. Shall we? INT. MORGUE - LATER - DAY Laurel is hunched over the corpse, the only light in the room coming from the overhead spot that illuminates her work. Fascinated by something, she digs deeper. And deeper. And looks up, her face a mixture of alarm and excitement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MORGUE - NIGHT Kay's LTD pulls up in front of the morgue. INT. MORGUE - CORRIDOR - NIGHT Two men in black suits hurry down the stairs and into the corridor outside the morgue. They hasten down the hallway, their shoes CLICKING in perfect lockstep, headed for those swinging doors at the other end. JAY and KAY. Men in Black on a mission. INT. MORGUE - NIGHT In the morgue, LAUREL has fallen asleep on her desk, her head in her arms. ROSENBERG'S CAT sits on the desk next to her, licking its paws. Suddenly, the cat looks up, MEOWING urgently. Laurel looks up and, following the cat's gaze, turns around slowly in her chair. JAY and KAY stand in the doorway, staring at her. Kay steps forward, holding out that black card again. It reforms into another kind of official ID, this time it says "DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH" LAUREL (into recorder) ...approximately 112 degrees at time of autopsy, indicating, quite impossibly, a post-mortem increase in body temperature. Examiner attempted to verify result rectally, only to find subject was, uh, without rectum. Which can only be described as...well...as really...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weird? Dr. Leo Menville, Department of Public Health. This is Dr. White. She looks up. Jay and Kay are standing there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well whoever you are, I'm afraid I'm going to need to see some ID. He hands her his CARTE NOIR, which changes to read "Dr. Menville, Department of Public Health." She hands it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You boys must not have much of a home life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We watch the morgues very carefully. You've got something unusual?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd say so -- triple homicide. She gets up and goes to the Arquillian's body, which is still out on a table under the lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first corpse was perfectly normal, except that he was broken in half, but when I opened up the other two -- well, look. She throws back a sheet, revealing (to them only, not us) the fully dissected Arquillian. Kay raises an eyebrow; Jay nearly retches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a skeletal structure at work here unlike anything I've ever seen. Kay steps past her, going straight to the body. He begins to examine it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll have a look at this one. Dr. White, why don't you and Dr. Weaver check out the other body?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way, Doctor. Jay and Laurel cross the room, to where ROSENBERG's corpse lies out on another gurney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one's even stranger. I did a full laparotomy. I started with the lesser curvature of the stomach -- though, if you want, we could begin at the gastro-esophageal junction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think, uh, we should start at the same place you did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Jay hears a MEOW and looks down. Rosenberg's cat is rubbing up against his leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your cat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess it is now. Came in with the bodies. She SNAPS one of her rubber gloves and reaches down (out of frame), sinking her hands into the body as she moves things aside. Just by the look on Jay's face, one can imagine how disgusting it is. Laurel digs in, up to her elbows. Jay winces. She pulls one bloody glove out, to wipe a strand of hair out of her face. He looks at her -- -- and she winks at him. He's surprised. She laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Dive right in. God knows he won't mind. Jay is reluctant, so she rolls her eyes and helps him, taking him by the hand and guiding him into the thick of the corpse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have very pretty eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank-you, but is this really the time to uh -- you know, come on to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, just walking the dog. (continuing) Feel that? Where the piloric junction would be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes. Exactly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now push that aside. Notice anything strange? Stomach? Liver? Lungs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope. All fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor, they're all missing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, of course they are. What I'm pointing out is that there are no pieces of them left. So they're intact, wherever they are. That we can be sure of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have we met before? I have the strangest feeling of deja vu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I was just going to ask you the same thing. Laurel looks at him sideways, skeptical, but also intrigued. She whispers to him. Confiding in him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. You wanna know what I really think? (re: Kay) But don't tell that guy. He looks like he's already under enough stress. (then) This body is not really a body, but it's actually some sort of transport unit for something else altogether. The question is: what? Jay just looks at her intrigued.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the way, stop me if I'm freaking you out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no...not at all. After a particularly gross GUSHY sound, he looks away, toward her. She's staring at him. Laurel leans over and lowers her voice, just for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I like to do sometimes? When it's really late?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... From the other side of the room, Kay CLEARS HIS THROAT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. He walks across the morgue to Kay, who is still examining the Arquillian. But Jay never takes his eyes off Laurel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very interesting. Got a real Queen of the Undead thing goin' on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of the body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dead body?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a clue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Keep her occupied. Try not to sound too dumb. ACROSS THE MORGUE, Laurel is still examining Rosenberg, now bent down next to his head, carefully studying his left ear. She notices something strange, turns, and calls over her shoulder to Jay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. White. Jay, in conversation with Kay, does not respond to what is not his name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. White. (still louder) Dr. White. He still doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WHITE! Kay nudges Jay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're up, Slugger. Jay turns and races across the room to rejoin her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at this. Jay leans down. There is strange stitching around the base of Rosenberg's ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that? He reaches out, touches the ear, then he actually turns it. With a soft CLICK -- -- it pulls away from the head. Like a latch. Jay and Laurel look at each other, astonished. Jay pulls again, and Rosenberg's entire face PUSHES OUT with a mechanical HUM, then HINGES OPEN, the whole face rotating out away from the rest of the artificial skull. A TINY LITTLE GREEN MAN SITS INSIDE ROSENBERG'S HEAD. Though not quite dead, the Tiny Little Green Man is gravely wounded. He staggers up out of a small control room inside Rosenberg's head, with gearshifts and viewing screens all around the inside of the skull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Far -- freaking -- out. They lean in closer. The Tiny Little Green Man (a BALTIAN) forces words out of his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must -- to pre -- prevent -- (searching for the word)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: TINY LITTLE GREEN MAN SITS INSIDE ROSENBERG'S HEAD

direction.raw_text: contest? No...to prevent -- JAY It's all right -- What are you trying to say? Struggle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: War? The Baltian nods vigorously. That's it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galaxy on -- or -- or -- Orion's -- (thinks) What is word? Be...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bed? Belt? Orion's Belt? The Baltian nods again, falls, and dies. Jay and Laurel look at the little dead alien, then at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "To prevent war, the galaxy is on Orion's Belt?"  The hell does that mean? (turns around) Hey! Kay! I mean, Dr., uh, whatever, come here! Kay begins over. Laurel looks at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Doctor Whatever"? You're not with the Department of Public Health, are you? Jay shakes his head -- but is now paying more attention to Kay, as he leads him toward the Little Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dead. Kay looks at the mess -- the body, the little dead man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rosenberg. Damn. Good man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the few I actually liked. Exiled High Prince.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was right -- this is an alien life form, and you're from some government agency who wants to keep it under wraps... Kay and Jay are not paying attention to Laurel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said "to prevent war, the galaxy is on Orion's Belt."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... This make total sense. How else do you explain New York? The other night I'm in a cab, this guy... FLASH! Without even looking at her, Kay whips out his neuralyzer and blanks her out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said there's a galaxy on Orion's Belt? That makes no sense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what he said. (to the dazed Laurel) Didn't he? Right after he -- (realizing) Oh, for Christ's sake, you did the flashy thing already.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, hi, whoever you guys are, I'm afraid I'm going to need to see some ID if you're going to be in the morgue, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure thing, sweetheart. Here you go. FLASH! He neuralyzes her again. Jay slaps his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop that -- KAY (to Laurel, ignoring Jay) Typical day, too much caffeine, get a life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: that thing probably gives you brain cancer!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never hurt her before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Never hurt her before"?! How many times have you done the flashy thing to this poor woman?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you worried about, you know, long term damage?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell happened to make you such a callous son of a bitch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I took this job. He heads out. Jay follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you never flashed me with that thing, did you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah. EXT. MORGUE - NIGHT Jay and Kay exit the morgue and walk towards their car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Kay, I really think I should be in charge of the flashy memory thing department.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not while I'm around, Slim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well you're a menace with that thing... An MIB containment vehicle pulls up, and four men dressed in black suits get out.
direction.name: direction
